name: Virtual Volumes View Catalog
summary: Learn about .VVV files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: VVV (Virtual Volumes View) allows you to catalog removable volumes and archive files and folders from a local computer. When you catalog a volume, the program creates the VVV file to store the volume's contents.
You can also use VVV (Virtual Volumes View) to search the volume's contents in the VVV file. For example, you can search the metadata in the folder to locate items in a specific folder in a volume.

instructions: You can open a VVV file with the FSoft VVV (Virtual Volumes View) program in Windows, macOS, and Linux. For example, to open a VVV file, select File → Open... or click the Open folder icon.
VVV (Virtual Volumes View) can convert catalog information in VVV files to .CSV and .TXT files. To convert a VVV file, select File → Export.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
